revised_title: Genetic Study of Tail-Short Mutation in Mice
tldr: This study investigates the effects of the Tail-short (Ts) gene mutation on mice, which causes shorter tails and smaller bodies. The research reveals various skeletal abnormalities and anaemia in Ts heterozygous mice, which can be traced back to deficiencies in blood islands in the yolk sac of 8-day embryos. The primary effect of the gene is suggested to be anaemia, which leads to differential retardation of various organs and results in the observed abnormalities.
